website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, no-frills beginner water ski rope that has a tensile strength that is capable of supporting up to 1,500 pounds.
pros: This is a 1-section, UV-treated 75-foot rope that is 3/8 inches in diameter
It is pre-stretched so it won't lose length after use and it features a 12-inch nonslip rubber handle
The purchase also includes a rope keeper to help eliminate issues with tangling
cons: It's designed for a beginner and may not be as durable as higher-priced water ski ropes

customer_reviews.title: Works great and a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a rope to tow our family wakeboarding and this has worked great! Been using it every weekend for a month with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: avaglerock

customer_reviews.title: Cheap lobster drag rope!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for dragging snorkelers around looking for lobster holes 😂
customer_reviews.author: Captain Janot

customer_reviews.title: Strong and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: I have used this over the summer and had no issues. Looking forward to another summer of fun
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Sunk after a few outings
customer_reviews.text: The handle no longer floats after just a few outings. My thin skinned kid would like more padding. (He needs to get off the XBox and toughen up.)
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find in the water
customer_reviews.text: This color blends too well so I can't see the rope in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Woot.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have a rope that floats. Less time cutting line from the PWC's impeller/drive shaft!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dugan

customer_reviews.title: good rope at good price
customer_reviews.text: works just as it should. Handles are holding up well and not peeling.
customer_reviews.author: NC man

customer_reviews.title: for tube not ski
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be heavier, but hopefully it will work for tubing not skiing,
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: but works great for watering behind the pontoon
customer_reviews.text: Rope was not color shown, but works great for watering behind the pontoon!
customer_reviews.author: Meme10_9

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: We used this rope twice - once for a child age 8 and once for an adult. It is fraying after only these two uses. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its not blue..
customer_reviews.text: The ski rope is nice but the picture showed blue. Its red..
customer_reviews.author: Drew Gipson

customer_reviews.title: Not same as picture
customer_reviews.text: The rope is totally different from picture. Doesn't have knuckle guard handle as shown. Still, not bad rope for price. They should correct picture.
customer_reviews.author: jimbrink

customer_reviews.title: That sinking feeling...
customer_reviews.text: A well assembled rope for skiing at 75', but the handle section is not removable, and the handle SINKS! It is what it is for recreational beginner skiing on two skis and is probably worth the promotional price.
customer_reviews.author: ADCX Rob

product_meta.title: RAVE 1-Section Promo Ski Rope
product_meta.description: RAVE's Water Ski Rope is perfect for beginner water skiers. The starter Water Ski Rope features 75' UV-treated, pre-stretched mainline with 12" HDR rubber wrapped aluminum handle. Rope keeper included. 1, 500 lb. tensile strength.
feature_bullets: RAVE's Water Ski Rope is perfect for beginner water skiers.
UV-treated & pre-stretched to stay colorful and will stay 75'
Rope keeper included to keep rope from tangling

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
